Majors












Breadcrumb








 

Majors

































World-Class Colleges and Majors
Our dedicated, friendly, and award-winning faculty will help you look further, reach higher, and think deeper. Learn more about the majors and minors offered by our colleges and schools.
M = Academic minors are also available for these majors.
T = Transfer Selecting major. If applying as a transfer student, specific pre-requisite courses must be completed.

COLLEGES/SCHOOLS






Marlan and Rosemary Bourns College of Engineering (BCOE)



Gain the innovative training needed to become a leading professional in your field.
Majors include:

Bioengineering
Computer Science
Environmental Engineering
Robotics

Learn More








College of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences (CHASS)



Be "at home in the world," exploring human meaning in social and historical contexts.
Majors include:

Creative Writing
Economics
Global Studies
Psychology

Learn More








College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS)



Improve the quality of life for those living in your community and around the world.
Majors include:

Earth Science
Entomology
Geology
Plant Biology

Learn More








School of Business



Learn how to address and solve the business challenges of the 21st century.
Seven concentrations include:

Actuarial Science
Finance
Information Systems
Marketing

Learn More










School of Education (SOE)



Become a thought leader, addressing important issues with research-based solutions.
Concentrations:

Community Leadership, Policy, and Social Justice
Learning and Behavioral Studies

Learn More








School of Medicine (SOM)



Explore human meaning in social and historical contexts.
Programs:

Graduate Medical Education
Medical Education Program
Master's and Ph.D. Programs in Biomedical Sciences

Learn More








School of Public Policy (SPP)



Improve the quality of life in your community and around the world.
Tracks include:

Health/Population Policy
International/Foreign Policy
Urban/Environmental Policy

Learn More

Disclaimer
This information is accurate and reliable at time of posting but may change without notice. Please contact Undergraduate Admissions for the most up-to-date information. Learn about our privacy policy.
Campus Security and Fire Safety Report
The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act) requires UCR (as an institution of higher education receiving federal financial aid) to report specified crime statistics on college campuses and to provide other safety and crime information to all current and prospective students and employees. The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available on the Chief Compliance Office website. If you would like a paper copy of the Report, you may contact the Clery Coordinator via email at clery@ucr.edu or by phone at (951) 827-6223.
